column4: hey whats that alternate to pcmanfm that's lightweight? thuna?
thunar's pretty light, but it drags in more packages than pcmanfm does
drags in more packages?? i like pcmanfm but its way too buggy

if you're using xubuntu or xfce already i'd just use thunar. though really you could just get used to cp/mv/rm; i feel that gui managers are only beneficial because of drag and drop and opening files easier
